intro: Sisymbrium athrocarpum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sweetcaraway, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, cylindrical seed pods. Sisymbrium athrocarpum is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
